org.corfudb.util.retry

Interface IRetry<E extends Exception,F extends Exception,G extends Exception,H extends Exception,O,A extends IRetry>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExponentialBackoffRetry, IntervalAndSentinelRetry, IntervalRetry, SentinelRetry

    public interface IRetry<E extends Exception,F extends Exception,G extends Exception,H extends Exception,O,A extends IRetry>
    The IRetry interface is used to support implementing retry loops. Special exceptions can be handled by registering a handler, which returns false if the loop should be aborted.

    Created by mwei on 9/1/15.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      This is a functional interface for handling exceptions.

      This is a functional interface for handling exceptions.

      • run

        default O run()
       throws E extends Exception,
              F extends Exception,
              G extends Exception,
              H extends Exception
        Run the retry. This function may never return.
        Throws:
        E extends Exception

      • runForever

        default void runForever()
                 throws E extends Exception,
                        F extends Exception,
                        G extends Exception,
                        H extends Exception
        Run the retry forever, unless stopped by the retryer. This function may never return.
        Throws:
        E extends Exception

      • getRunFunction

        IRetryable<E,F,G,H,O> getRunFunction()
        Get the function that needs to be retried.

      • handleException

        boolean handleException(Exception e,
                        boolean unhandled)
        Handle an exception which has occurred.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception that has occurred.
        unhandled - If the exception is unhandled.
        Returns:
        True, to continue retrying, or False, to stop running the function.

      • getHandlerMap

        Map<Class<? extends Exception>,IRetry.ExceptionHandler> getHandlerMap()
        Get the exception handler map for the retry logic.
        Returns:
        The exception handler map for the retry logic.

      • passException

        default <T extends Exception> IRetry<E,F,G,H,O,A> passException(Class<T> exceptionType)
        Pass an exception by throwing it to the main body.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of exceptions to pass.
        Parameters:
        exceptionType - The exception to pass to the main body.
        Returns:
        An IRetry, to support a fluent API interface.

      • onException

        default <T extends Exception> IRetry<E,F,G,H,O,A> onException(Class<T> exceptionType,
                                                              IRetry.ExceptionHandler<T,E,F,G,H,A> handler)
        Register an exception handler when an exception occurs. Note that only one exception handler can be registered per exception type.
        Parameters:
        exceptionType - The type of exception to handle.
        handler - The action to take when an exception occurs. The handler should return true if the retry logic should continue, or false if the logic should abort.
        Returns:
        An IRetry, to support a fluent API interface.

      • onException

        default <T extends Exception> IRetry<E,F,G,H,O,A> onException(Class<T> exceptionType,
                                                              IRetry.ExceptionHandlerWithoutRetry<T,E,F,G,H> handler)
        Register an exception handler when an exception occurs. Note that only one exception handler can be registered per exception type.
        Parameters:
        exceptionType - The type of exception to handle.
        handler - The action to take when an exception occurs. The handler should return true if the retry logic should continue, or false if the logic should abort.
        Returns:
        An IRetry, to support a fluent API interface.

      • setOptions

        default IRetry<E,F,G,H,O,A> setOptions(Consumer<A> settingsFunction)
        Configure settings for the underlying class. The consumer will be given access to the underlying retry type to configure type-specific options.
        Parameters:
        settingsFunction - A consumer with access to the underlying retry type.
        Returns:
        An IRetry, to support a fluent API interface.

      • retryLogic

        boolean retryLogic()
        Apply the retry logic.
        Returns:
        True, if we should continue retrying, false otherwise.
